intro: Juncus sphacelatus var. himalensis, commonly known as the Himalayan rush, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Himalayas. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, rocky or alpine environments. The plant has slender, grass-like stems that are often丛生 (clumped) and bear small, spike-like inflorescences. Its flowers are usually greenish or brownish and are adapted to withstand cold and high-altitude conditions. This variant is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil in high-altitude ecosystems.
